Class CollegeTester

  • java.lang.Object
    • CollegeTester

  • public class CollegeTester
extends java.lang.Object
    Standard output user interface for the College class, which is a collection of Students. There is an option for interaction via the console and also for batch operations. The operations supported are
    • Adding a new student to the college.
    • Finding an existing student.
    • Retrieving the login id of an existing student.
    • Removing a student from the college.
    • Adding the grade point value and credit units earned for a course taken by an existing student.
    • Finding a student with the college's highest GPA.
    • Giving the total number of students in the college.
    • Printing out to the console all the students in the college.
    • Putting a comment that is ignored i.e. has no effect.
    Version:
    September 23, 2017
    Author:
    Harmanjit Randhawa

      • systemPrompt

        public static java.lang.String systemPrompt()
        Prints a prompt to show that it's the system printing out.
        Returns:
        the prompt used by the system for the user to read.

      • isInteractiveModeFromUser

        public static boolean isInteractiveModeFromUser(java.util.Scanner in)
        Prints onto standard output a query to find out if the session is interactive and echoes the response if the session is not interactive. If the user using the Scanner in types any word starting with y or Y, we say that it IS interactive, otherwise, it is not.
        Parameters:
        in - an open input stream
        Returns:
        true if the session is interactive, false otherwise

      • echo

        public static void echo(java.lang.String str)
        Prints to standard output the string str to be used if the session is not interactive to show what the input was.
        Parameters:
        str - string to print to standard output

      • printAvailableCommands

        public static void printAvailableCommands()
        Prints as menu choices to standard output the commands available.

      • getNextCommand

        public static Command getNextCommand(java.util.Scanner in,
                                     boolean notInteractive)
        Prints out a prompt to standard output and reads the next line. It continues reading as long as the line read is empty. If notInteractive is true, it outputs the line read by using the method echo (ignoring blank lines read).
        Parameters:
        in - an open input stream
        notInteractive - with a value of true indicates that the session is not interactive and that the line read must be echoed
        Returns:
        the command in String form with "INVALID" as a possibility

      • processCommands

        public static void processCommands(College college,
                                   java.util.Scanner in,
                                   boolean notInteractive)
        Processes the commands that it gets using in and it asks the college to carry out various functions.

        Precondition: the college is not null.

        Parameters:
        college - the College that will have data manipulated
        in - an open input stream
        notInteractive - flag which when true, does not echo the input

      • add

        public static void add(College college,
                       java.util.Scanner in,
                       boolean notInteractive)
        Creates a student and adds it to the college. It asks the user from stnadard input for a first and last name in a single line and subsequently it asks for an address (that is free formatted and may have blanks).

        Precondition: the college is not null.

        Parameters:
        college - the college of Students
        in - an open input stream
        notInteractive - declares that the session is not with the console but likely from redirected input from a file

      • find

        public static void find(College college,
                        java.util.Scanner in,
                        boolean notInteractive)
        Finds and prints to standard output the student given an student number which is obtained from standard input. If the student number given by the user is erroneous or if the student is not in the college, an error message is given onto standard output.

        Precondition: the college is not null.

        Parameters:
        college - the college of Students
        in - an open input stream
        notInteractive - declares that the session is not with the console but likely from redirected input from a file

      • getLogin

        public static void getLogin(College college,
                            java.util.Scanner in,
                            boolean notInteractive)
        Obtains and prints to standard output the login id of a student whose student number is obtained from standard input. If the student number given by the user is erroneous or if the student is not in the college, an error message is printed onto standard output.

        Precondition: the college is not null.

        Parameters:
        college - the college of Students
        in - an open input stream
        notInteractive - declares that the session is not with the console but likely from redirected input from a file

      • remove

        public static void remove(College college,
                          java.util.Scanner in,
                          boolean notInteractive)
        Deletes the student whose student number is obtained from standard input. The removed student is printed to standard output or an error message is printed if not found.

        Precondition: the college is not null.

        Parameters:
        college - the college of Students
        in - an open input stream
        notInteractive - declares that the session is not with the console but likely from redirected input from a file

      • addCourse

        public static void addCourse(College college,
                             java.util.Scanner in,
                             boolean notInteractive)
        Asks the user using standard input for the student number and if the student number is valid, it asks the user for the credits of a course (which should be numeric and positive) and if there are no errors, it asks for the points for the course (which should be numeric, positive and an integer). The credits and points are used to calculate the student's GPA. The errors are reported to standard output.

        Precondition: the college is not null.

        Parameters:
        college - the college of Students
        in - an open input stream
        notInteractive - declares that the session is not with the console but likely from redirected input from a file

      • findHighestGPA

        public static void findHighestGPA(College college)
        Prints one of the students with the college's highest GPA given that there might be more than one student with the highest GPA: only one is printed. If the college does not have any students yet, an error message is printed.

        Precondition: the college is not null.

        Parameters:
        college - the college of Students

      • giveTotal

        public static void giveTotal(College college)
        Prints to standard output the total number of students in the college.

        Precondition: the college is not null.

        Parameters:
        college - the college of Students

      • printOutCollege

        public static void printOutCollege(College college)
        Outputs to standard output all the students of the college in a format enclosed in square brackets with one student per line.

        Precondition: the college is not null and toString has been defined both for Student and for College.

        Parameters:
        college - the college of Students

        public static void printError(java.lang.String msg)

        Parameters:

      • printStudent

        public static void printStudent(java.lang.String what,
                                Student stud)
        Outputs the student onto standard output; however, if stud is null, an error is printed.
        Parameters:
        what - gives what was done to the student, e.g. "added", "removed"
        stud - whose information will be printed.

      • getStudent

        public static Student getStudent(College college,
                                 java.util.Scanner in,
                                 boolean notInteractive)
        Obtains from standard input the student number and if it is valid, it returns the student from the college with that student number.

        Precondition: the college is not null.

        Parameters:
        college - the college of Students
        in - an open input stream
        notInteractive - declares that the session is not with the console but likely from redirected input from a file
        Returns:
        the student with the student number read from the scanner in or null if the student number is erroneous or no student with that student number is found in the college.

      • getStudentNumberFromUser

        public static int getStudentNumberFromUser(java.util.Scanner in,
                                           boolean notInteractive)
        Asks the user using standard input to enter a student number. If the student number is not numeric, report the error.
        Parameters:
        in - an open input stream
        notInteractive - declares that the session is not with the console but likely from redirected input from a file
        Returns:
        the student number if it is numeric and return -1 if an error was encountered.

      • getPointsFromUser

        public static double getPointsFromUser(java.util.Scanner in)
        Asks the user using standard input for the points which should be numeric and positive: report errors to standard output
        Parameters:
        in - an open input stream
        Returns:
        the points obtained from the user or -1 if an error was encountered

      • getCreditsFromUser

        public static int getCreditsFromUser(java.util.Scanner in)
        Asks the user using standard input for the credits which should be numeric and positive (and an integer). Report errors to standard output.
        Parameters:
        in - an open input stream
        Returns:
        the credits obtained from the user or -1 if an error was encountered

      • hasExactlyTwoWords

        public static boolean hasExactlyTwoWords(java.lang.String str)
        Determines if str consists of exactly two words.

        Precondition: str is not null.

        Parameters:
        str - string to be examined for a blank inbetween
        Returns:
        true if str has exactly two words with at least one blank between the words, false otherwise

      • isNumeric

        public static boolean isNumeric(java.lang.String str)
        Determines if str consists of digits exclusively.

        Precondition: str is not null.

        Parameters:
        str - has characters that should be numeric but might not be
        Returns:
        true if str consists of characters that are digits, false otherwise
